content: The first paragraph talks about what a Version Control System is and its use in recovering projects.
The second paragraph talks about Git and differentiates it from the centralized control system.
What does a Git repository cover? This is what the third paragraph talks about.
In the fourth paragraph, the use of references to navigate repositories is discussed.
The fifth paragraph talks about working outside the develop branch.
The sixth paragraph talks about the internal working of Git to work as a version control system.
The seventh paragraph tells how the blob changes when dealing with multiple branches.
The eighth paragraph shows how to create a branch locally.
The ninth paragraph talks about the keyword "origin" and its reference.
The tenth paragraph explains what a pull request is and its use to the repo owner.
The eleventh paragraph talks about 'git rebase' and how it can be problematic. The sub-paragraph further talks about how to use it and its commands.

The visual aids show the internal file structure of the objects used to manage the Git system. The first image shows the emergent object relations with a single file branch, the second shows the intricate relationship as Git groups common files to save space.
